paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common ATTR-associated mutation, V30M, positioned near the N-terminal end of strand 'B', is located proximal to one of these disordered regions in the frayed state.
The involvement of these disordered structural elements in the unfolding and aggregation process is supported by the fact that the most common ATTR-associated mutation, V30M...
In the context of a dissociated monomer, a destabilizing V30M mutation would likely further promote unfolding, exacerbating irreversible aggregation, including amyloid formation.
Another ATTR-associated mutation, L55P, is likely to abolish pairing between strands D and A to drive unfolding and aggregation through a similar mechanism.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation destabilizes the TTR tetramer, promoting misfolding and aggregation.

variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is the most common variant associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: The most common ATTR-associated mutation, V30M, positioned near the N-terminal end of strand 'B', is located proximal to one of these disordered regions in the frayed state.
Another ATTR-associated mutation, L55P, is likely to abolish pairing between strands D and A to drive unfolding and aggregation through a similar mechanism.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Another ATTR-associated mutation, L55P, is likely to abolish pairing between strands D and A to drive unfolding and aggregation through a similar mechanism.
Another ATTR-associated mutation, L55P, is likely to abolish pairing between strands D and A to drive unfolding and aggregation through a similar mechanism.

functional_data.summary: The L55P mutation disrupts the structural integrity of TTR, leading to increased aggregation.

variants.additional_notes: The L55P mutation is associated with a high risk of developing ATTR.
key_quotes: Another ATTR-associated mutation, L55P, is likely to abolish pairing between strands D and A to drive unfolding and aggregation through a similar mechanism.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
